UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile in the Recycle+ application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserProfile entity.

registrationDate.description: Date and time when the user registered.

totalPoints.description: Current points balance available for redeeming rewards.

lifetimePoints.description: Total points ever earned by the user, used for ranking.

RecyclingRecord.title: RecyclingRecord
RecyclingRecord.description: Represents a record of a user's recycling activity.

id.description: Unique identifier for the RecyclingRecord entity.

userName.description: The display name of the user who submitted the record.

materialType.description: Type of material recycled (e.g., plastic, paper, glass).

quantity.description: Quantity of material recycled (e.g., in kg or number of items).

recyclingDate.description: Date and time when the recycling occurred.

pointsEarned.description: Points earned for this recycling activity.

Reward.title: Reward
Reward.description: Represents a reward that users can redeem with their points.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Reward entity.

requiredPoints.description: Number of points required to redeem this reward.

imageUrl.description: URL of the image representing the reward.

Redemption.title: Redemption
Redemption.description: Represents a user's redemption of a reward.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Redemption entity.

redemptionDate.description: Date and time when the reward was redeemed.

pointsDeducted.description: Number of points deducted from the user's account for this redemption.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and scalability for the Recycle+ application. User profiles and their associated data (recycling records, redemptions) are structured under the `/users/{userId}` path, providing clear ownership and simplifying security rules. Rewards are stored in a separate top-level collection, `/rewards`. All admin-related collections and cooldown-related fields have been removed for simplification.
